intro: Zephyranthes phycelloides, commonly known as the pink rain lily, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a bulbous perennial that produces showy, pinkish-white flowers during the rainy season. The plant has strap-like, grassy leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires ample sunlight to bloom. Its name refers to its association with rain, as it often flowers after rainfall.
